info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 6:40PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Light snow increases over Central and North-central Montana tonight through Sunday morning... Light mountain snow will continue this evening and will begin to expand to the plains after midnight as a cold front moves southward through the region. Snowfall accumulations will be light and will generally range from trace amounts up to a couple of inches, highest along the Continental Divide and northerly upslope areas along the MT highway 200 corridor from Roger`s Pass to the Eddies Corner area. In addition to the snow, a northerly wind shift will accompany the frontal passage and winds may briefly gust up to 35 mph. Although snowfall amounts will be light, those traveling should still be prepared for reduced visibility below one mile at times and winter driving conditions tonight into Sunday morning. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.
